subtopics.name: Responsible Conduct of Research
subtopics.description: This subtopic focuses on the ethical guidelines and regulations that scientists must adhere to, ensuring that research is conducted with integrity and transparency. It relates to Epistemology by addressing how knowledge is acquired and validated, and to Cognitive Science by understanding how human behavior and decision-making influence research practices.

subtopics.name: Informed Consent and Human Subjects
subtopics.description: This subtopic deals with the ethical considerations surrounding the use of human subjects in scientific research, emphasizing the importance of informed consent and protecting participants' rights. It integrates with Ontology by examining the nature of human existence and dignity, and with Practical Wisdom by applying ethical principles in real-world contexts.

subtopics.name: Animal Welfare and Ethics
subtopics.description: This subtopic addresses the ethical treatment of animals used in scientific research, balancing scientific progress with animal welfare. It connects with Philosophy of Science by evaluating the methods and implications of scientific inquiry, ensuring that scientific advancements do not compromise ethical standards.

subtopics.name: Conflict of Interest and Bias
subtopics.description: This subtopic explores how personal interests or biases can influence scientific research, highlighting the need for transparency and accountability. It aligns with Interdisciplinary Synthesis by integrating insights from various domains to ensure that scientific knowledge is both reliable and ethically sound.

subtopics.name: Public Engagement and Communication
subtopics.description: This subtopic focuses on the ethical responsibilities of scientists in communicating their findings to the public, ensuring that information is accurate, accessible, and responsible. It relates to Practical Wisdom by applying knowledge in real-world contexts, fostering trust between scientists and society.
